title: Refactor source-specific processing with adapters and add Yglesias title format
description: Refactor pipeline source-specific branching into a maintainable adapter architecture. Current processor behavior includes multiple feed-specific conditionals for Levine and Yglesias (title formatting, body cleanup, source URL extraction). Implement a pluggable source adapter layer and migrate existing behaviors into adapters. Include requested Yglesias title format: 'YYYY-MM-DD - Slow Boring - <Title>'.
acceptance_criteria: Core processor has no feed_slug if/elif branches for source-specific logic; Levine and Yglesias behaviors are preserved or improved; New Yglesias title format is active for newly processed episodes; Tests cover adapter behaviors and regressions.
notes: Refactor shipped end-to-end. Core processor no longer has feed_slug if/elif branches for source-specific logic.

title: Define source adapter interface and wiring points in processor
description: Design a small source adapter contract for newsletter-specific behavior. Proposed methods: format_title(date_str, subject_raw, subject_slug), clean_body(raw_email, body), extract_source_url(raw_email, date_str, subject_raw), and optional metadata hooks. Document where the adapter is resolved and invoked in process_email_bytes.
acceptance_criteria: Adapter interface documented in code comments/design notes; processor wiring points identified; no behavior changes yet.
notes: Completed: introduced source adapter contract and registry in pipeline/source_adapters.py; processor wiring now resolves adapter by feed_slug and delegates title, body cleanup, and source URL extraction.

title: Implement adapter registry and migrate Levine/Yglesias logic out of processor conditionals
description: Create source adapter modules (default, levine, yglesias), register by feed_slug/preset key, and move source-specific logic from process_email_bytes into adapter implementations. Keep behavior parity for existing Levine URL extraction and Yglesias body cleanup/source URL extraction.
acceptance_criteria: process_email_bytes delegates source-specific work to adapters; existing output parity validated on representative sample emails.
notes: Completed: migrated Levine and Yglesias source-specific logic out of processor conditionals into LevineAdapter and YglesiasAdapter.

title: Add Yglesias title format: date + Slow Boring + post title
description: Implement Yglesias-specific title formatter in the adapter so new episodes are titled 'YYYY-MM-DD - Slow Boring - <Title>'. Ensure raw subject normalization strips newsletter prefixes where needed while preserving meaningful punctuation/casing.
acceptance_criteria: New Yglesias episodes use requested title format; Levine title behavior unchanged; unit tests cover formatting edge cases.
notes: Completed: Yglesias title format now 'YYYY-MM-DD - Slow Boring - <Title>' for new episodes via YglesiasAdapter.format_title.

title: Regression tests, rollout verification, and docs update for adapter refactor
description: Expand tests to cover adapter dispatch and source behaviors (Levine and Yglesias). Run full suite and lint. Verify one live newsletter per source post-refactor to ensure queue->audio->feed path still works. Update AGENTS/skill docs if operational behavior changes.
acceptance_criteria: Tests pass; no regression in feed/audio outputs; docs updated for any changed operator expectations.
notes: Completed: updated tests for adapter behavior and source URL/cleanup; uv run ruff check pipeline and uv run pytest both passing (24 tests). Restarted my-podcasts-consumer.
